messages.subject: Fwd: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Friends(?)/Family
messages.msgSnippet: ... excitement with them about unschooling and all the information I was discovering on the internet. ... help them see the positives of unschooling.  I tried
messages.messageBody:
>>>>Today I shared my
excitement with them about unschooling and all the information I was
discovering on the internet.
>of trying to
help them see the positives of unschooling. I tried to tell them that I
believe that many children have been failed by the ps system.
>I am really disappointed! I don't get to go out much and talk to other
Mothers or have any social outlets because my children are so little and
Nanci in Idaho

- >
>What she is saying is that her opinion, which is based on NOTHING is more
valid
>than my opinion, which is based on a lot of time and research and the love
>of my children.
>Robin Stark


~~~~~~~~~IMHO: There's a part of us looking for approval from others when
we start a homeschooling discussion with people who are following the status
quo... I've learned only to share my excitement with like minded/open
minded friends (who won't feel intimidated).
This is one of the major reasons I LOVE THIS Forum! I want to thank each
and every one of you for expressing your thoughts & experiences from
educating your kid(s).
Diana Asberry
(I promise to send an intro tonight...)
